meanings.definition: Drink plentiful amounts of alcohol and enjoy oneself with others in a noisy, lively way.
meanings.sent1: During the celebration, we were wassailing with our friends and having a great time.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends decided to go wassailing at the local pub to celebrate.
meanings.sent3: The neighbors found our wassailing quite entertaining as we sang and danced in the street.
meanings.sent4: The city streets echoed with the sounds of wassailing as people celebrated the festival.
meanings.sent5: The image of wassailing under the stars will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: Go from house to house singing carols at Christmas.
meanings.sent1: On Christmas Eve, we wassailed through the neighborhood, spreading holiday cheer.
meanings.sent2: Children love wassailing around the town, singing carols and receiving treats.
meanings.sent3: The wassailing group accidentally knocked over a snowman while singing at a house.
meanings.sent4: The sound of wassailing voices filled the chilly night air with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: Wassailing with friends and family is a cherished Christmas tradition for many.

meanings.definition: Engage in lively and noisy festivities, often involving drinking alcohol.
meanings.sent1: The village square was filled with people wassailing and celebrating the harvest.
meanings.sent2: At the wedding reception, guests were wassailing and toasting to the newlyweds.
meanings.sent3: The wassailing at the party got so loud that the neighbors called the police.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere was festive and merry as everyone joined in the wassailing.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of wassailing brings the community together for a night of merriment.
